pros: Great fun to work with students
cons: Salary was not very competitive

pros: Friendly work environment Great managers
cons: Not much room for growth

pros: It is hard to think of a universal pro for being employed here. If you are White and Christian-passing, you'll feel belonging and you'll fit in instantly.
cons: - Leadership is woefully under - Major pay inequities; org had external consultants do an equity audit of sorts around compensation and didn't share results transparently. However a few folks on campus have access to the data. There is about a $20-30K salary inequity when it comes to just gender - Huge gap between what the org says about its commitment to inclusion and what minorities, especially Black and Brown folks, actually experience - Scapegoat and use passive-aggressive silencing tactics if you criticize or push against the dominant White Supremacist culture - If you're marginalized, you have to fit the "they saved me" narrative for you to succeed...which plenty of BIPOC immigrants play into and take advantage of. - pushed out their very first Black Chief Diversity Officer and his two women of color office mates

pros: They have Flexible hours available for students
cons: They are not nice sometimes

pros: It is a great place to work with friendly faculty and a rewarding management. Great communication and understanding people. As long as you have interest tasks are not much difficult to, and they are always ready to help.
cons: Tasks are usually repeating and there is no other field for students to branch into.

pros: I loved the people there
cons: everybody was so helpful and nice

pros: Very flexible work environment and great coworkers
cons: Horrible pay and you will never get a raise. Benefits aren’t great.

pros:
Everyone is pleasant to your face
The students are kind and hard-working
cons:
They only support employees who are graduates of the college 

They say they want change, but they make change impossible

They make it impossible for directors to reward excellence or disincentivize laziness and incompetence

job_title: Undergraduate Research Assistant in Moorhead, MN
pros: Had a great time getting to do research and connecting with professors.
cons: The pay is quite low.

review_title: Wonderful place to be employed with mission driven work
pros:
Mission driven work
Youthful atmosphere
Love my job
Wonderful people
Focusing on diversity and inclusion
cons: They offer lower pay compared to other colleges and universities in the area.

pros:
- Close to home
- Flexible
cons:
- The pay is not sustainable for students
- I didn't get any real-life experience

review_title: Love the benefits salary is low
job_title: Business Office Manager in Moorhead, MN
pros: Week off at Christmas. Great pto. Tuition discount
cons: Low salary. Hard to retain employees because they can go elsewhere for a large increase in pay.

job_title: Associate Director of Admissions in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Solid connections all across campus. Lots of ability for collaboration.
cons: Change can sometimes take longer than one would like.

pros: Flexible nice staff is fun to talk to
cons: There is a cap of how much you can earn

pros: It felt good to be there, we all connected like family
cons: Moorhead is really really cold

review_title: Out of Touch with Living Wages
pros: Facilities has great, hard-working people in their department. There really is a separate culture from the rest of the campus, which is nice.
cons:
No advancement within the College, benefits have been stagnant or outpaced by inflation, and the overall pay is very low for the area.

Administration population is shockingly high, and along with their overall higher salaries it seems to be draining the payroll account.

review_title: Great people to work with and for!
pros: Everyone gets along great and fellow workers quickly become friends.
cons: Not great benefits when it comes to healthcare/dental/vision options.

pros: I really appreciated how flexible my bosses were. The mentoring opportunities are awesome.
cons: Pay isn’t super high, but that’s to be expected as a student intern.

pros: Students are the best part
cons: Salary is too low for the job

pros: Free food is the best part of working in dining services
cons: There isn't much to say

pros:
Many opportunities/work study
Collaborative environment
Individualized
Builds relationships
cons:
Lack of communication 
High tension

review_title: A lot of good friendly people to work with!
pros: A lot of options to work!
cons: The pay is quite low.

pros: Welcoming and open to hiring students
cons: Pay is not the best

pros: Plenty of check-ins, clear deadlines and goals
cons: difficulty communicating with co workers

pros: Wonderful community dedicated to educating tomorrow's leaders. The college has modified its business curriculum to better prepare students for future careers.  My co-workers really care about each other and students.  It is a great community to be a part of as an employee.  It is a good place to begin a higher education career.
cons: Administrators tend to play multiple roles on campus which makes it very difficult to maintain a work week that is less than 50-60 hours.  Salaries for mid-level administrators are not as competitive as they should be and the college tends to lose those experienced people to the universities nearby.

pros: Best-paying job on campus. It pays over a dollar more per hour than any other on-campus job.  The managers are big into helping you onto your future career. If you get in good with your supervisors, they'll be great references for you when you are job hunting. Also, your fellow student managers are great people. They're a bunch of fun to work with.
cons: It begins to consume your life. I need money, so I work more hours. Then I need more money, so I work more hours. I've begun to feel like I do nothing but work. Also, I don't really like smelling like fries and popcorn.

pros: The people here are fantastic, the energy and excitement of the students is evident in everything they do, and I love the work that I did every day.
cons: I wish there was more of a focus on research, especially in the sciences.  The faculty all have really great opportunities to get students involved, and I don't think they are really executing those opportunities to make the most of the student's time there.

review_title: Convenient on campus jobs for students
pros: Hours match class schedule so it is really easy to pick up short shifts during the day.  Great way to meet other students.  Guards rotate so you are able to work on homework and multi-task during shift.
cons: Pay not as good as what you could find off campus.  difficult to get many hours if that's what you are looking for.

review_title: Stellar nurses are sent out from Mhd. Concordia Nursing!!!
job_title: Office Manager, CC Nursing Department in Moorhead, MN
pros: Kindness to staff, respect, professors are incredibly knowledgeable; my husband had Concordia graduated nurses assisting him right after his heart surgery; extraordinary!!!
cons: I do not have “down sides” with the work; however, JESUS needs to be re-incorporated in everything that occurs at this awesome college!!!!

pros: A fast paced work environment and great teamwork make Admissions a fun department to work in. We create a lasting impact on prospective students and their families.
cons: For some, the priorities that are listed are unclear which can create some tension within the team. The chain if command can be confusing at time especially when you need an immediate answer.

pros: Great hours available for student workers. Lots of variety allowed for mastering of many jobs and skills relevant to the field of supply chain management and retail management.
cons: Sometimes workers would be unmotivated and not perform to the standards given. Other than that workers would perform all necessary tasks given to them in a timely manner.

review_title: A great place to work in a great community.
pros: Great work/life balance. Short hours. Lots of friendly people to work with, and the student workers are great. Overall a wonderful place to work.
cons: Tight budgets mean low pay and no raises. Not much opportunity for advancement. Management style was a bit too collaborative for my taste.

pros:
Flexible hours - you can work as many hours as you'd like. 
You work with the same people all semester so you can better get to know how to help them.
cons:
Pay is just above minimum wage, which can be hard as a student.
Some students can be hard to work with.

pros: This was an amazing place to work! Great bosses and fellow employees who all worked to make it an atmosphere of positivity and healthy competition.
cons: Due to the nature of the job this was slightly boring on some nights but that is unavoidable in calling.

job_title: Camp Counselour for Concordia Language Villages in Bemidji, MN
pros: Got to meet people from different countries and make international friends. Also to work with kids is very good
cons: the salary was not the best

review_title: decent place to work part-time before finding a career
pros: One of the only jobs where I didn't have to use my brain, so I could just "turn off".
cons: they only paid minimum wage

pros: Some of the best people to work with
cons: Besides the set salary. There are not too many cons

pros: Opportunity to work during summers as a student
cons: Not able to work many hours during semester

pros: Awesome flexibility, thoughtful supervisors, and cool opportunities
cons: One con is that campus doesn't pay a lot.

pros: Fun environment, great to work with the professors
cons: Minimum wage and no opportunity to increase pay
